|Title=Know the definition of febrile neutropenia
|Description=Fever and neutropenia <500
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Amélie Servettaz
|Order=1}}

<big>Definition neutropenia: PNN < 1500/mm3 but the infectious risk is major if PNN < 500/mm3</big>.

<big>The definition of '''febrile neutropenia''' is therefore:</big>.

<big>- '''Fever''': T°≥38°C on 2 occasions or for more than 1 hour or any T°≥38.3°C)</big>

<big>- In a patient with '''Neutrophil Polynuclei (PNN) <0.5G/L'''</big>

<big>- '''It's a therapeutic emergency'''</big>

properties.question: What are the criteria for diagnosing febrile neutropenia in a patient?
properties.option_a: Fever of 38°C or higher on three different days
properties.option_b: Neutrophil count greater than 1500/mm3 with a fever of 38°C or higher
properties.option_c: Fever of 38.3°C or higher and a neutrophil count less than 0.5G/L
properties.option_d: Neutrophil count less than 500/mm3 with a fever of 39°C or higher
